Matter is composed of atoms, which consist of protons, neutrons, and electrons. Protons and neutrons reside in the nucleus, with protons having a positive charge and neutrons having no charge. Electrons orbit around the nucleus, having a negative charge and participating in chemical bonding and reactions. The number of protons determines the element of an atom, while the number of neutrons can vary, leading to different isotopes. The number of electrons in an atom is equal to the number of protons and determines the chemical properties of an element.
